entry.name: QUnit.push
entry.title: QUnit.push()

argument.name: message
argument.desc: A short description of the assertion

entry.desc: DEPRECATED: Report the result of a custom assertion

longdesc.p: This method is deprecated and it's recommended to use it through its direct reference in the assertion context.
QUnit.push reflects to the current running test, and it may leak assertions in asynchronous mode. Checkout assert.push() to set a proper custom assertion.
Invoking QUnit.push allows to create a readable expectation that is not defined by any of QUnit's built-in assertions.

example.desc: Define a custom mod2 assertion that tests if the provided numbers are equivalent in modulo 2.
